creator: KAGleason
title: WebRTC Video Chat in 20 Lines of JavaScript
materials_required: PubNub account with publish and subscribe keys
description: This project demonstrates how to build a simple WebRTC video chat application using JavaScript and the PubNub API. It enables users to make peer-to-peer video calls directly in a web browser without needing plugins.
steps: Set up a local web server using Python to avoid CORS errors during testing. Navigate to your project directory in the terminal and run 'python -m SimpleHTTPServer <port-no>' (Python 2) or 'python -m http.server <port-no>' (Python 3).
Create an HTML file with a div element to hold the video stream, a login form for specifying the username, and a call form for dialing another user.
Include the jQuery library, the PubNub JavaScript SDK, and the PubNub WebRTC SDK in your HTML file.
Sign up for a PubNub account to obtain publish and subscribe keys, which are required to set up the phone.

Implement the login function that sets up the phone using the entered username as a UUID and instantiates PubNub using your publish and subscribe keys. Also, define the callback function that triggers when the phone is ready to place a call.

Implement the phone.receive function to define a callback that takes a session as a parameter for when a call event occurs. Also, define session.connected to invoke after receiving a phone call, and to begin video chatting. Then, define session.ended which is called after invoking phone.hangup.
Implement the makeCall function that uses the phone.dial function to place a call to the number entered in the call form. Only when the user did log in can they proceed to this step.
Test the app by opening it in two browser windows and initiating a call between the users.
